title: Stack with initial sync POS
body:
#### System information

erigon version 2022.08.1-alpha-7326fbe8 Linux64x

Erigon stack with initial chain initialization

Erigon args: `
./erigon --chain=sepolia --datadir=./chaindata --port=30310 --authrpc.port=8553 --torrent.download.rate=256mb --private.api.addr=0.0.0.0:9093 --torrent.port=42073 --db.pagesize="4kb" --http.api="eth,net,erigon,engine,debug,trace" --ws --http.corsdomain="*" --http.addr="0.0.0.0" --http.vhosts='*' --http.port=11020 --authrpc.vhosts="*" --authrpc.addr="0.0.0.0"`

Prysm args: ` ./beacon-chain --sepolia --datadir='./prysm_data' --http-web3provider='http://0.0.0.0:8553' --jwt-secret=/mnt/md2/erigon-sepolia/erigon/chaindata/jwt.hex --rpc-host=0.0.0.0 --rpc-port=4000 --monitoring-host=0.0.0.0 --genesis-state=genesis.ssz --terminal-total-difficulty-override 17000000000000000 --accept-terms-of-use `

: received an undefined ee error" prefix=initial-sync
```
@artjoma you sure that the right JWT is used in both nodes? 403 is a usual sign of wrong JTW. Can you explicitly specify the JWT in erigon too?

Fixed this issue. Steps:
* shutdown Erigon
* removed jwt.hex
* start Erigon
* shutdown Prysm
* start Prysm

Right now works fine.

Hey @artjoma also reported another issue @mandrigin . Over here it seems erigon can't process the block while syncing.
https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/issues/10877#issuecomment-1209141886

```
[WARN] [08-09|09:24:09.437] [5/7 Execution] Execution failed         block=1658817 hash=0x6ec18e10b257326452b249705b66350c3ef2963da75da9e769c065ca0401938a err="could not apply tx 0 from block 1658817 [0xa7261682ce6b1f5d70bdacb4ee13dbf466f72e9149cfc1a756031654c180f268]: nonce too low: address 0x2f14582947E292a2eCd20C430B46f2d27CFE213c, tx: 0 state: 7"

This is however a valid sepolia block as referenced here:
https://sepolia.etherscan.io/block/0x6ec18e10b257326452b249705b66350c3ef2963da75da9e769c065ca0401938a
@Giulio2002 can you check this one? @nisdas ease provide the exact version of Erigon you are running.

@nisdas  This problem related to broken integration between Erigon and Prysm for POS
* try to remove jwt.hex auth file. See steps bellow
* use latest version of applications
* look at applications arguments what I post, it works well
The error posted here is different from the error in our issue @artjoma . Which is why I am pinging the erigon team with it as it seems like a genuine issue
